alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:19PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Williamson County through 200 PM CDT... At 119 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Thompson`s Station, or 9 miles southwest of Franklin, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Brentwood, Spring Hill and Thompson`s Station. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 56 and 70. Interstate 840 between mile markers 20 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
